t: Psalm 83
Prayer to Frustrate Conspiracy Against Israel
A Song. A Psalm of Asaph.
Do*pn not keep silent, O God! Do*ld not hold Your peace, And*ld do not be still, O God!
For*ld behold, Your enemies make a tumult; And*ld those who hate You have lifted up their head.
They*ld have taken crafty counsel against Your people, And*ld consulted together against Your sheltered ones.
They*ld have said, “Come, and let us cut them off from being*i a nation, That*ld the name of Israel may be remembered no more.”
For*ln they have consulted together with one consent; They*ld form a confederacy against You:
The*ld tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites; Moab*ld and the Hagrites;
Gebal,*ld Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia*ld with the inhabitants of Tyre;
Assyria*ld also has joined with them; They*ld have helped the children of Lot. Selah*ipg
Deal*pn with them as with*i Midian, As*ld with*i Sisera, As*ld with*i Jabin at the Brook Kishon,
Who*ld perished at En Dor, Who*ild became as*i refuse on the earth.
Make*ld their nobles like Oreb and like Zeeb, Yes,*ld all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
Who*ld said, “Let us take for ourselves The*ld pastures of God for a possession.”
O*ln my God, make them like the whirling dust, Like*ld the chaff before the wind!
As*ld the fire burns the woods, And*ld as the flame sets the mountains on fire,
So*ld pursue them with Your tempest, And*ld frighten them with Your storm.
Fill*ld their faces with shame, That*ld they may seek Your name, O Lord.*s
Let*ld them be confounded and dismayed forever; Yes,*ld let them be put to shame and perish,
That*ld they may know that You, whose name alone is*i the Lord,*s Are*ild the Most High over all the earth.
